email.text:
Hope your summer holidays are going well!
We're getting in touch with two opportunities from our sponsors. Be sure to check them out!
email.heading: Facebook Hack-a-Project 2018
email.text:
Facebook is launching Hack-a-project! Consider it an extended hackathon with learning and mentoring attached to it!
This is a 6 - 8 week programme kicking off in October 2018, designed for 2nd and 3rd year students, looking to apply for a Software Engineering internship with Facebook.
Selected students will come to the Facebook office, once a week in the evening to focus on understanding the whole development cycle, and build a project. Each session will consist of a talk, and practical applications with group mentoring support. Dinner will also be provided!
*Facebook will not be providing this project; students will be coming up with the project.
In addition, we will be sharing tips on “how to crush your coding interview”, and also do a mock interview with you, where feedback will be provided to help you improve.
All selected participants will be guaranteed an interview for the Facebook internship!
**If you would like to sign-up please follow this link https://hackaprojectseptember2018.splashthat.com/**
**Password: HAP2018**
**You will be sent a link to complete a “HackerRank” (a coding challenge). Upon passing this, you will be asked to provide your CV, and this will be screened for this programme. To be considered, you will have to complete all of these steps by 31st August!**
email.heading: Netcraft Final Year Project Kickstarter Hackathon

event.text:
Netcraft is running a hackathon in Bath for final year students over the weekend of 8th September.
Over the past few years, students working with Netcraft have produced some of the best final year projects at the top UK universities, including winning the Best Project Prize at each of Imperial, Bath and Bristol, and securing firsts for all of the projects attempted.
If you're interested, check out the event description with instructions on how to take part here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1684249138351948/
